pushto.site¶

Handles site-dependent transformations between the telescope attitude and equatorial coordinates.

Provides:

  • Location

  • Site

class pushto.site.Site(td_ta_address, td_eq_address, pd_eq_address, pd_ta_address, location, ctx=None)¶

Bases: Thread

PushTo class

Parameters:

  • td_ta_address (str) – telescope data/telescope attitude address

  • td_eq_address (str) – telescope data/equatorial address

  • pd_eq_address (str) – pointing data/equatorial address

  • pd_ta_address (str) – pointing data/telescope attitude address

  • location (pushto.site.Location) – the location of the telescope

  • ctx (zmq.Context or None) – zmq context, optional

>>> site = Site.setup(cfg, ctx)
>>> site.connect()
>>> site.start()
>>> site.close()
close()¶

Close all sockets.

connect()¶

Bind and connect the sockets.

reset_alignment()¶

Reset the alignment data.

start()¶

Start the thread’s activity.

It must be called at most once per thread object. It arranges for the object’s run() method to be invoked in a separate thread of control.

This method will raise a RuntimeError if called more than once on the same thread object.

class pushto.site.Location(lat, lon, elev, pres=0, temp=0, relh=0)¶

Location object.

Parameters:

  • lat (float) – site latitude in degrees

  • lon (float) – site longitude in degrees

  • elev (float) – site elevation in meters

  • pres (float) – site pressure in hPa

  • temp (float) – site temperature in Celsius

  • relh (float) – site relative humidity

equatorial_to_horizontal(ra, dec, utc=None)¶

Convert from equatorial to horizontal coordinates.

Parameters:

  • ra (float) – right ascension in hours

  • dec (float) – declination in degrees

  • utc (astropy.time.Time or None) – utc time, optional (default is current utc)

Returns:

azi in degrees, alt in degrees

Return type:

list(floats)

horizontal_to_equatorial(azi, alt, utc=None)¶

Convert from horizontal to equatorial coordinates.

Parameters:

  • azi (float) – local azimuth in degrees

  • alt (float) – local altitude in degrees

  • utc (astropy.time.Time or None) – utc time, optional (default is current utc)

Returns:

ra in hours, dec in degrees

Return type:

list(floats)
